name: 金仕淳
objective:
The course aims to learn how digital images are practiced in real-world applications, especially in medical images and computer vision.
This class will introduce the image's composition, image adjustment, composition, and even feature extraction for radiomics to apply to image detection and recognition. We will introduce some popular image processing algorithms about image processing and implement them in medical imaging projects.
schedule:
Week	Topic
Week 1	What is Digital Image Processing-Digital Image Fundamentals
Week 2	Introduction to Python environment setting
Week 3	Introduction to Medical Image Format
Week 4	Intensity Transformations, Spatial Filtering, and kernel function (I)
Week 5	Intensity Transformations, Spatial Filtering and kernel function (II)
Week 6	Project Report (1)
Week 7	Intensity-Based Segmentation
Week 8	Morphological Image Processing
Week 9	Feature Selection and Classifying
Week 10	Project Report (2)
Week 11	Fourier Properties and Filtering in the Frequency Domain (1)
Week 12	Fourier Properties and Filtering in the Frequency Domain (2)
Week 13	Fourier Properties and Filtering in the Frequency Domain (3)
Week 14	Project Report (3)
Week 15	Image restoration
Week 16	Image reconstruction
Week 17	Feature extraction, representation, and radiomics for medical
Week 18	Project Report (4)
materials:
1. Digital Image Process 4/e Gonzalez & Woods
2. The Image Processing Handbook 5/e John C. Russ
3. Medical Image Reconstruction: A Conceptual Tutorial Gengsheng Lawrence Zeng
課程對應SDGs指標: SDG4：優質教育（Quality Education）SDG9：產業創新與基礎設施（Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure）
